intro: Neesia synandra, commonly known as the slender neesia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Australia, particularly in Queensland and the Northern Territory. The plant is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open woodland or heathland environments. Neesia synandra is often found in areas with high humidity and is adapted to seasonal rainfall patterns.
